result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adan Perez-Garcia

defendant.name: Perez-Garcia, Adan
defendant.address: 622 West Historic Mitchell Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adan Perez-Garcia in court.  Attorney John Stephen Joyce in court for Adan Perez-Garcia.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel waived interpreter for today's Court date.  Defense counsel requests plea hearing only for next court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Adan Perez-Garcia appeared by video.  Attorney John Stephen Joyce appeared by video for Adan Perez-Garcia.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel needs offer and discovery on new case.  Defense counsel requests adjourned pretrial conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Adan Perez-Garcia in court with attorney John Stephen Joyce.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as interpreter: Reme Bashi.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Gilbert Carrasco, Investigator with the District Attorneys Office.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 41.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 078530,
Payable Number: 1026358,
Receipt Number: 22RP032957,
Amount: $20.00
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney John Stephen Joyce in court appearing as a friend of the Court, defendant Adan Perez-Garcia not in court, in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for status conference. Court adjourns case for preliminary hearing. Court finds good CAUSE to extend times limits on preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Branch PE.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adan Perez-Garcia in court by video, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Fred Svensson.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant says he has retained Attorney John Joyce. That information has not been verified. Attorney Joyce does not appear. Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, Defendant to remain in custody until a device becomes available.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Previously sworn as Spanish interpreter: Liesl Monroy.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with IM-D (4/27/1985).

Defendant Adan Perez-Garcia in court with attorney William Scott Nelson.  Defendant Adan Perez-Garcia in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adan Perez-Garcia appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT NOT INTERVIEWED. WISHES TO RETAIN ATTORNEY FROM PENDING CASES.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.k warrant
